newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-Piper Jafray cuts Microsoft.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Piper Jafray cuts Microsoft.

text.p: -- Piper Jaffray analyst David Rothschild said he had downgraded Microsoft Corp to market performer from buy based on valuation concerns.
-- The analyst said he believed Microsoft was fairly valued at current levels.

-- In published comments, he noted that Microsoft's positive earnings surprise for the second quarter ended in December of $0.57 per share was "primarily due to lower than expected operating expenses."

-- Echoing comments by Microsoft executives, he said that, "We believe Microsoft can sustain a 20 percent growth rate for the forseeable future, therefore out price target is 25 times our preliminary calendar 1998 earnings estimate of $3.25, or $82 per share."
-- However, the analyst expressed concern that Microsoft is "not likely to grow at historical rates" in 1998 and 1999.
